newsitem.title: USA: NY consumer natgas prices up on higher costs.
newsitem.headline: NY consumer natgas prices up on higher costs.

text.p: Consumers of natural gas in in most utility territories of New York state can expect to see a change in their heating bills for service in December and January due to a sharp rise in the cost of natural gas supplies in the market, according to the state of New York Public Service Commission.
This cost reflects the actual cost that the utility pays for natural gas and is market driven.

The New York Mercantile Exchange pricing index had projected that the market price of gas would rise in December. These prices are used as benchmarks in the gas supply contracts used by the utilities and will be passed to consumers through a gas adjustment clause. Colder than normal weather resulting in greater use of natural gas by consumers also is a contributor to the change.
Other costs regulated through rates set by the Commission have remained stable or declined.

Based on current projections, heating customers using 300 therms may experience an increase in their billings ranging from 5 percent to 25 percent from 1995 levels.It is projected that customers in the Long Island Lighting Company and New York State Electric and Gas Corp service territories will not be subject to the above increases.
